references.reason: This paper is foundational for the concept of navigable graphs and greedy routing, and it is extensively cited in the target paper.
This paper introduces the "small-world phenomenon", which is the empirical inspiration for the study of navigable graphs.
This paper provides a generative model for small-world networks, which is relevant to the study of navigable graphs.

references.paper_title: Approximate nearest neighbor queries in fixed dimensions
references.reason: This paper provides a foundational algorithm for approximate nearest neighbor search, which is closely related to the construction of navigable graphs.

references.paper_title: Approximate nearest neighbor algorithm based on navigable small world graphs
references.reason: This paper introduces the HNSW algorithm, a popular and efficient method for approximate nearest neighbor search that uses navigable graphs.
